title: Tom Brady shows support for Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX after saying he ‘doesn’t have a dog in the fight’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady initially stated he wasn't supporting the Patriots in Super Bowl LX, sparking backlash from fans and former teammates.
Brady later expressed support for Patriots owner Robert Kraft on Instagram, urging the team to secure a seventh championship.
Critics, including Vince Wilfork and Robert Spillane, reacted negatively to Brady's initial neutral stance given his past with New England.

title: Former Colts Pro Bowl center thinks Drake Maye should have won NFL MVP over Matthew Stafford
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Former Colts center and ESPN analyst Jeff Saturday prefers Patriots QB Drake Maye for MVP over Rams' Matthew Stafford.
Saturday cites Maye's versatility and stats: 6-0 record against common opponents, higher QBR, 4,394 passing yards.
ESPN's Mina Kimes voted for Maye, noting his superior stats and efficiency despite fewer offensive weapons than Stafford.

title: 5 X-factors for Patriots, Seahawks in Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Sam Darnold's performance under New England's blitz-heavy defense is crucial for Seahawks' Super Bowl success.
Patriots' QB Drake Maye may exploit Seahawks' defense with scrambling, targeting their lower rush defense ranking.
Patriots' linebacker Robert Spillane's ankle injury could impact the team's run defense against Seahawks' Kenneth Walker.

title: Patriots get good Drake Maye news on final injury report, but 2 captains are listed as questionable
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye has no injury designation and will play in Sunday's Super Bowl.
Linebackers Harold Landry and Robert Spillane are listed as questionable for the Patriots.
Rookie defensive lineman Joshua Farmer is the only other Patriots player listed as questionable.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: "Hell or High Water," a Western film by Taylor Sheridan, is now streaming on Netflix.
"Splitsville," a 2025 romantic comedy featuring Kyle Marvin and Dakota Johnson, is streaming on Hulu.
The 2026 Winter Olympics in Italy are available for streaming on Peacock, including a Gold Zone service.

title: ‘We all we got, we all we need’: How Stefon Diggs’s  voice sparked a New England rallying cry
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs inspired the New England Patriots with the phrase 'we all we got, we all we need'.
The motivational phrase became popular among Patriots fans and local figures, sparking a rallying cry.
Diggs faces upcoming court arraignment for assault charges but remains a key leader on the team.

title: She’s running her first-ever marathon to raise money for Mass. General Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Armanda Demeris, 34, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to raise money for the Massachusetts General Hospital Fund.
The Massachusetts General Hospital Fund supports emergency response, cancer care and research, and the Home Base Program.
Demeris's relations to these causes include her best friend as a nurse, her husband a first responder, and her mother's cancer battle.

title: Foodie’s Markets to close South End location, resulting in neighborhood outcry
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Foodie's Markets South End location will close in June after 28 years, sparking community concern over losing essential retail space.
The Croft School initially planned to occupy the space but withdrew due to neighborhood objections, seeking to avoid further division.
Owner Victor Leon cited costly building updates as the reason for closing and will focus on the South Boston location.

title: The anonymous Drake Maye Lover Instagram account has developed quite the following
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: The Instagram account @DrakeMayeLover has nearly 400,000 followers since its creation in May 2024.
Drake Maye, Patriots quarterback, acknowledges the account which expresses strong support and affection for him.
The anonymous account owner plans to reveal identity after meeting and getting a photo with Drake Maye.

title: Tom Brady’s Super Bowl LX neutrality strikes a nerve with Patriots fans
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tom Brady expressed neutrality about the Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX matchup, causing mixed reactions among Patriots fans.
Many Patriots fans are disappointed by Brady's lack of support for New England, viewing it as a detachment from his legacy.
Others believe Brady's new roles as a broadcaster and Raiders minority owner justify his neutral stance on the game.
